intro: Lasianthus biermannii subsp. biermannii, commonly known as the Biermann's lasianthus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences. The plant typically features opposite, lanceolate leaves and produces clusters of tubular, often brightly colored flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
